Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl, with part of flange remaining; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: from centre, black-figure decoration consisting of lion to right (belly and part of hind leg with added red remaining); traces of incised rising rosette with red centre as filling ornament; in outer frieze, black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx seated to left (tail, tip of wing and rump with red remaining); traces of incised pendant and full rosettes (very worn) as filling ornament; bands at broken edge of rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 322, no. 1450, pl. 192)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2116) (phase 2)
